intro: Odontostemma barbatum var. hirsutissimum, commonly known as the hairy odontostemma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
